justification: Identifies B’s RB need but ignores B’s stated love of dual-threat QBs and comfort stashing injured players—selling Clark and Anderson contradicts that. Overlooks TE scarcity/value for B. From A’s side, dealing a Tier 1 workhorse RB for two injured assets clashes with A’s conservative, floor-first style and existing solid QB (Sam Martinez). Roster impacts (A’s RB depth) are underexplained, and the acceptance probability seems optimistic. Rationale is brief and lacks injury timeline and preference-driven nuance.
